panels.description: The time that the data between two consecutive barriers gets fully processed, i.e. the computation results are made durable into materialized views or sink to external systems. This metric shows to users the freshness of materialized views.
panels.title: Barrier Latency

panels.description:
Alerts in the system group by type:
            - Too Many Barriers: there are too many uncommitted barriers generated. This means the streaming graph is stuck or under heavy load. Check 'Barrier Latency' panel.
            - Recovery Triggered: cluster recovery is triggered. Check 'Errors by Type' / 'Node Count' panels.
            - Lagging Version: the checkpointed or pinned version id is lagging behind the current version id. Check 'Hummock Manager' section in dev dashboard.
            - Lagging Epoch: the pinned or safe epoch is lagging behind the current max committed epoch. Check 'Hummock Manager' section in dev dashboard.
            - Lagging Compaction: there are too many files in L0. This can be caused by compactor failure or lag of compactor resource. Check 'Compaction' section in dev dashboard.
            - Lagging Vacuum: there are too many stale files waiting to be cleaned. This can be caused by compactor failure or lag of compactor resource. Check 'Compaction' section in dev dashboard.

targets.expr: ((storage_max_committed_epoch - storage_min_pinned_epoch) >= bool 6553600000 unless + storage_min_pinned_epoch == 0) + ((storage_max_committed_epoch - storage_safe_epoch) >= bool 6553600000 unless + storage_safe_epoch == 0)

panels.title: Alerts

panels.description: Errors in the system group by type

targets.expr: sum(state_store_meta_cache_size) by (instance) + sum(state_store_block_cache_size) by (instance) + sum(state_store_limit_memory_size) by (instance)

panels.description: Executor cache statistics

targets.legendFormat: Join - cache miss - {{side}} side, join_table_id {{join_table_id}} degree_table_id {{degree_table_id}} actor {{actor_id}}
Join - total lookups - {{side}} side, join_table_id {{join_table_id}} degree_table_id {{degree_table_id}} actor {{actor_id}}
Materialize - cache hit count - table {{table_id}} - actor {{actor_id}}  {{instance}}
Materialize - total cache count - table {{table_id}} - actor {{actor_id}}  {{instance}}

panels.title: Executor Cache

targets.expr: (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_miss_count[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, actor_id) ) / (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_total_count[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, actor_id))
targets.legendFormat: join executor cache miss ratio - - {{side}} side, join_table_id {{join_table_id}} degree_table_id {{degree_table_id}} actor {{actor_id}}

materialize executor cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} - actor {{actor_id}}  {{instance}}

panels.description:
Objects are classified into 3 groups:
                    - not referenced by versions: these object are being deleted from object store.
                    - referenced by non-current versions: these objects are stale (not in the latest version), but those old versions may still be in use (e.g. long-running pinning). Thus those objects cannot be deleted at the moment.
                    - referenced by current version: these objects are in the latest version.
panels.title: Object Size

panels.description:
Objects are classified into 3 groups:
                    - not referenced by versions: these object are being deleted from object store.
                    - referenced by non-current versions: these objects are stale (not in the latest version), but those old versions may still be in use (e.g. long-running pinning). Thus those objects cannot be deleted at the moment.
                    - referenced by current version: these objects are in the latest version.
panels.title: Object Total Number

panels.description: The number of bytes that have been written by compaction.Flush refers to the process of compacting Memtables to SSTables at Level 0.Compaction refers to the process of compacting SSTables at one level to another level.
panels.title: Write Bytes

panels.description: The remote storage read/write throughput
panels.title: Storage Remote I/O (Bytes/s)

panels.description: We first record the total blocking duration(ns) of output buffer of each actor. It shows how much time it takes an actor to process a message, i.e. a barrier, a watermark or rows of data, on average. Then we divide this duration by 1 second and show it as a percentage.
panels.title: Actor Backpressure
